text: <@U02AUNA0P> / <@U0U9WJB7F>  i chatted with katrina to get some clarification on the bar graph elements on activity detail screens. She said that this feature was dropped bc of scope but she’d like to keep a copy of the designs with them and explore adding it in post-launch.
okay sounds good, i’ll drop it from the spec then. thanks for checking on that!

Have we designated who’s spec’ing items for the global spec guide? ( <@U1A1A9L7N> )
I have elements either dropped in or placeholders on the pages (currently pinned up). I’m essentially pulling the global elements from the specs the team made - they aren’t necessarily separate specs
I can sync up with y’all soon after I get out of a meeting, if that was confusing

Grab me/us we you’re done. I know there are some things I’m not touching considered Global elements but don’t think any other person has instances of them outside of my own screens. We should figure out how I need to get that info to you

<!channel>: 

I wanted to touch base on some news that we just heard from the Adidas team. 

As you know, the relationship between product design and a finite amount of time to build said product has been a theme on this project. It is for every project, but we’ve all felt the pressure for Compass in particular. 

A few minutes ago, we learned that the Adidas team has decided to push back the initial launch of Compass to March. 

This is welcome news on several fronts, of course. Though I think for this channel it doesn’t change much of how we’ve been operating. We’ve known there will be an initial launch and iterations thereafter. As we’ve been designing everything — including all the research, IxD work, visuals, and production — we’ve built variations on everything (e.g. launch and post-launch versions). 

While we’re just learning about this shift, I believe the product roadmap we’ve been working toward will remain mostly the same. 

That said, I also think that some of the conversations we’ve had in recent days — such as the onboarding discussion yesterday — may change slightly given more time. 

I’ll be sharing as we know more, but wanted you to hear as soon as possible. 

Thanks as always for being such an amazing team. I can’t overstate that. I know it’s been a complicated project, but our team has delivered thoughtful, consistent work since day 1. 

I’m happy to answer any questions/concerns, and will be working with everybody as we move forward to understand the best way to adapt our workflows accordingly. Come find me if you’d like to chat about anything.
yessssss
thanks for the update <@U0265G76F>
you gonna let <#C037D5R8X> know?
yep. The dev team was briefed earlier, but yes
cool

I think one thing to keep in mind is that this move is largely to accommodate what we already know. While I don’t have details, I know there’s going to be a feature freeze relatively soon. So there won’t be a ton of shift in terms of features or possibility, but I hope it changes some of the conversations we’ve been having in recent weeks.
